content.description:
Start just left of

Jimboliar

, climbing a series of "scoops" or holes down low and then a blanker face crux to the anchor below the big tree.
content.protection: 11 bolts plus a two bolt anchor.

content.description: After a high first clip, continue up soft edges with fun stems and huge flakes.
content.location: This is the route furthest to the right.  Start above the right end of the log.

climbs.name: Ladies First
climbs.fa: Teresa and Jesse Swann, Jimbo Bruick, Danielle Harshman, Dave Anderson

content.description: Climb up the low angle arete on big scoops and flakes.  After 50 feet of easy climbing, follow a rail to surmount the bulge.  Though originally graded as a 9, several holds have broken, raising the grade slightly.
content.location: This is the first route left of the approach trail.

content.description: This has very fun edging up a slab with generally solid rock.
content.location: This is the route just right of the approach trail.  Climb above the left end of the log.

content.description: This is a fun, slabby route with a few unique moves. Climb between the 2 white water streaks until the features lead you onto the right hand streak. Reach left to clip, then use wide feet, and do some delicate moves until you reach a perfectly sized (for my fingers) mono-pocket that leads to better holds pulling the small overlap.
content.location: It is left of the huge huecos, through the middle of the 2 water streaks.

content.description:
This has fun climbing to a small overlap that is easier than

Andy Wants Some Candy

.
content.location:
This is the leftmost of the 5 bolted routes on the slab, to the left of the two white water streaks. Start from a small belay clearing among bushes and trees about 10 feet up and left from

Andy Wants Some Candy

.
